question_sentence: Critics described a controversial portrait of whom as "demonic" and a "monstrosity"?
evidence: The portrait depicts the king in the red uniform of the Welsh Guards against a backdrop of vivid red brushstrokes. Queen Camilla was not among the critics however, reportedly telling beleaguered artist Jonathan Yeo: "Yes, you've got him."

question_sentence: Smoke from Canada's wildfires this week threatened the air quality of which US state?
evidence: More than 140 fires in British Columbia, Alberta, Saskatchewan and the Northwest Territories have burned at least half a million acres this spring, and fine particle levels tied to the wildfire smoke are expected to affect the air quality in states such as Minnesota, Montana, Wisconsin and the Dakotas.

question_sentence: Who is taking over as Russia's defence minister after Sergei Shoigu steps down?
evidence: The announcement came as a surprise, not just because Shoigu was seen as a close ally to President Putin, but also because Belousov was an economist before entering politics. Analysts have suggested the move indicates that Russia is keen to rein in the mounting costs of its operations in Ukraine.

question_sentence: Google is introducing what new feature to its search engine in the US?
evidence: Users of the Google search engine in the US will start getting AI-generated answers at the top of the search results. The tech giant anticipates that AI overviews will be accessible to "over a billion people by the end of the year".

question_sentence: California's Governor Gavin Newsom and London Mayor Sadiq Khan attended a climate change summit in which city-state?
evidence: Pope Francis addressed delegates at the "Climate Crisis to Climate Resilience" conference, which is being held at the Pontifical Academies of Science and Social Sciences. Find out more with this week's episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Who did Maryland Democrats nominate to replace retiring senator Ben Cardin?
evidence: Maryland Democrats nominated Angela Alsobrooks over three-term congressman David Trone to succeed retiring Senator Ben Cardin. Meanwhile, Republican Larry Hogan secured his party's nomination for the Senate race, setting up a competitive race in a state that hasn't had a Republican senator since 1987.

question_sentence: Which film got a standing ovation lasting almost eight minutes at its premiere at the 77th Cannes Film Festival?
evidence: George Miller's frenetic prequel to 2015's "Mad Max: Fury Road", starring Anya Taylor-Joy, was met with a 7min 50s ovation from the Cannes crowd – a welcome headline for organisers, who have battled a series of off-screen controversies in the run-up to the festival.

question_sentence: Joe Biden and Donald Trump agreed to how many televised presidential debates?
evidence: Biden and Trump have agreed to participate in two debates before the November US election. CNN will host the first on 27 June and ABC will host the second on 10 September. Neither will have a live audience.

question_sentence: Protests erupted in which country over a "foreign influence" bill that critics say will scupper the country's hopes of joining the EU?
evidence: On Tuesday, the nation's parliament passed the controversial legislation, which will oblige organisations to disclose foreign funding. Critics say the "draconian" laws will hamper Georgia's aspirations to join the EU, and move the country instead towards Russia's sphere of influence.

question_sentence: Which comedian is facing criticism for complaining about political correctness in comedy?
evidence: Seinfeld declared there has been a scarcity of funny TV sitcoms due to "the extreme left and PC crap, and people worrying so much about offending other people". In response, far-right influencers praised the former "Seinfeld" star, while others called him out of touch, a grump or just plain wrong.

question_sentence: Which phenomenon recently caused the night sky to light up across the globe?
evidence: A series of solar flares and coronal mass ejections from the sun recently created dazzling auroras around the world. The strongest flare occurred on Tuesday and was deemed an X8.7, with the X-class denoting the most intense flares possible.

question_sentence: President Joe Biden and former President Donald Trump have agreed to their first debate of 2024. In which month will the event occur?
evidence: President Biden and Donald Trump have accepted an invitation from CNN to debate on June 27, a historically early showdown that will set the tone for the final months of the 2024 campaign.

question_sentence: The most popular US baby names of 2023 were announced this week. Which name was added to the top 10 list for the first time?
evidence: Mateo made it into the boys’ top 10 list for the first time, becoming the sixth-most popular boys’ name in 2023 and edging Benjamin off the list, according to recently released data from the Social Security Administration.

question_sentence: Which global leader welcomed Russian President Vladimir Putin for a multiday visit?
evidence: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese leader Xi Jinping met in Beijing on Thursday. Global officials have raised concerns about the two leaders binding their countries closer in the face of Western sanctions.

question_sentence: Which country saw thousands of residents evacuate this week amid raging wildfires?
evidence: More than 100 wildfires burning across Canada forced widespread evacuations this week. Hazardous smoke from the blazes has also been wafting into the US and reducing air quality.

question_sentence: US grocery prices fell for the first time in a year, according to inflation data released this week. Which food item saw one of the most notable price drops?
evidence: Two grocery items saw notable price drops: Apples, in the wake of a supply glut last year, plunged 12.7%. And eggs — last year’s poster child for rising prices — were down 9%.

question_sentence: A new Miss USA was crowned this week amid a flurry of resignations. Which state does she represent?
evidence: The new Miss USA, Savannah Gankiewicz from Honolulu, Hawaii, stepped up to be crowned on Wednesday.

question_sentence: Which country built a floating pier that will allow the delivery of humanitarian aid to Gaza?
evidence: A US-built floating pier that will allow for humanitarian aid to flow into Gaza was anchored to a beach along the besieged enclave. Dozens of trucks are expected to begin moving the aid ashore in the coming days, US officials said.

question_sentence: Which streaming network will broadcast the NFL’s Christmas Day football games?
evidence: Netflix will air two NFL games on Christmas Day as the streaming giant eyes a major expansion into live sports.

question_sentence: Which chain restaurant is reportedly considering filing for bankruptcy due to slumping sales?
evidence: Red Lobster is abruptly closing at least 48 restaurants in the US, according to a leading restaurant liquidator. The chain has also tapped a restructuring expert as its chief executive, a possible indicator of an impending bankruptcy.

question_sentence: What happened at the Concord Mall carnival in Delaware?
choices: A 16-year-old boy was killed and a 17-year-old boy was injured in a shooting
The carnival was shut down due to fist fights
The carnival continued as planned without any incidents
The carnival was relocated to another venue due to safety concerns

question_sentence: What is the new role of Robbie Jester at Deep Blue at Kitty Knight?
choices: He is overseeing the culinary operations.

question_sentence: Which U.S. President once founded a bike race in Delaware?
What is the name of the movie that is set to close out Ti West’s beloved horror trilogy, and when is it scheduled for release?
Who is the artist behind the robot street art campaign in Wilmington, and what is his intention behind it?
choices: John Doe, to promote his new art gallery
David Sanchez, to put smiles on faces and add a splash of unexpected color to the city
Michael Smith, to advertise a new tech startup.
Emily Johnson, to raise awareness about environmental issues.

question_sentence: What sports does Meredith Finger excel in at Archmere Academy?
Who was elected to represent District E on the Red Clay Consolidated School Board in the recent school board elections?
When will the Real ID be required for domestic flights in the United States?
In 2023, how many employees in the city of Dover made over $100,000, and which department had the most employees in this salary range?
choices: 68 employees, with the majority in the police department
50 employees, with the majority in the fire department
75 employees, with the majority in the city management
68 employees, with the majority in the city management

question_sentence: What was the incident involving the Superintendent of the Laurel School District?
choices: The Superintendent was involved in a school scandal.
The Superintendent was charged with driving under the influence (DUI).
The Superintendent was involved in a financial fraud
The Superintendent was involved in a physical altercation.
